name: Elk Ridge Resort

reviews.text: My husband and I booked a room for two nights midweek in July. We hadn`t been to the area in a number of years and heard that ElkRidge Resort was very nice. We booked a King Standard room.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, but...

reviews.text: The driveway into the resort is long and winding and opens up to reveal the lovely stone Golf clubhouse and pavillion and then the Log resort building a bit further up the road.
reviews.title: Beautiful location with terrible staff

reviews.text: The grounds are beautiful and very well kept with a lovely pond behind the lodge with a patio area for sitting. The manicured lawn is surrounded by a full forest setting which is quite magnificient.
reviews.title: Worst food of my life

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is an impressive driveway up to the lodge. The rooms on one side of the resort, however, do overlook the parking lot and we went to check in being sure to ask for a room on the backside of the lodge. We decided to upgrade to the King deluxe room. The front desk check in clerk was not particularly warm or friendly but she did give us our room keys and sent us on our way. The foyer and lobby area are spacious and have very high vaulted ceilings. The restaurant is at the back of the lodge overlooking the pond.
reviews.title: Great location, too bad about the service

reviews.text: Our room was the last one at the end of the hall on the ground floor. The room had a lovely kingsize bed, gas fireplace, plasma tv, desk, willow chairs and coffee table and large closet area. There was a large picture window looking out on to the spacious wood deck with wood railing. There was also another window and a walk through door onto the deck. There is no access to the grounds from the deck. There is a small table and two chairs on the deck. The closet held an iron and ironing board and several wood hangersand also two bathrobes. The bathroom had laminate hardwood floors, shower stall, large soaker tub, granite counter top and very nice lighting.
reviews.title: Elk Ridge-Gem of the North

description: Elk Ridge Resort is a four-star destination/lifestyle resort located in the province of Saskatchewan, Canada, deep in the heart of the boreal forest. The nearest city, Prince Albert, is 40 minutes by car.Recognized by the Audubon Society and under consideration for its Golf Course Accreditation Program, Elk Ridge has taken great care in the use and management of the forest to build its championship golf course and resort.Elk Ridge Resort has earned a reputation as a four season paradise. Nature and outdoor experiences are abundant at Elk Ridge and in the surrounding areas of the Lakeland region and Prince Albert National Park.For visitors who want to make a permanent move into nature, real estate is available at Elk Ridge in the form of luxury villas or residential building lots.
